definition: to record/record (written account)/note-taker/record (in sports etc)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
variant of 紀錄片|纪录片[ji4 lu4 pian4]

sentences.english: A spectrum is then obtained and telemetered to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 然后记录它的光谱，并将数据通过遥测系统发回地面。

sentences.english: Will they beat the 83 century record for the championships?Yes or no?
sentences.chinese: 他们这次比赛能打破原来83次单球破百的记录吗？

sentences.english: Under the match of dark set, once one day inside sweep two records of counties.
sentences.chinese: 在暗组的配合下，曾有一天之内横扫两个县的记录。

sentences.english: The motion that the remark of the last speaker be expunged from the record.
sentences.chinese: 该提议要求把最后一个发言的人的讲话从记录上除掉。

sentences.english: Let me get down some information about your apartment first. Whatis yourpropertysaddress?
sentences.chinese: 让我先记录一些关于你的房子的资料。

sentences.english: It covers what the apostle John saw in a vision on the Island of Patmos.
sentences.chinese: 它记录了使徒约翰在拔摩海岛所看到的异象。

sentences.english: This records the start and end time of the reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 这记录着复制的开始和结束时间。

sentences.english: There is a discrepancy in the combat log when casting Paladin healing spells.
sentences.chinese: 战斗记录当中对骑士的治疗记录有错误。

sentences.english: There is a discrepancy in the combat log when casting Paladin healing spells.
sentences.chinese: 战斗记录当中对骑士的治疗记录有错误。

sentences.english: If you'd just sign the register.
sentences.chinese: 每个职员必须在工作时间记录簿上签名。

sentences.english: Its global temperature records stretch back to 1850.
sentences.chinese: 该机构的全球温度记录始于1850年。

sentences.english: Then they timed the reactions that caused the new thymine bonds to form.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们记录了产生新的胸腺嘧啶键形成的反应。

sentences.english: After light stimulation, negative waves were recorded from each electrode.
sentences.chinese: 经光刺激后，负波被每个电极记录下来。

sentences.english: This topic explains how to sort your recordset.
sentences.chinese: 本主题说明如何对记录集排序。

sentences.english: Try to avoid sending large records to the front end to be transformed there.
sentences.chinese: 尽量避免发送大型记录到前端并在那里转换。

sentences.english: To have centralized logging and security.
sentences.chinese: 具有集中的日志记录和安全性。

definition: variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to keep/to preserve/extant/to remain (from the past)
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
lit. to go upstream/to trace sth back to/to date from
to load into/to record/to write into/to enter (data)/to go into (the records)/to go down (in history)
